  "title": "Guest Relations / Reservations Officer",
  "description": "Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Guest Relations / Reservations Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Maitama, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Main Functions


	The Guest Relations / Reservations Officer ensures exceptional guest experiences by managing personalised guest interactions and handling reservation processes with precision and luxury service standards.
	This role is responsible for welcoming VIP guests, managing pre-arrival communication, coordinating special requests, and ensuring accurate reservation handling to optimise occupancy and guest satisfaction.


Role Responsibilities
Guest Relations:


	Welcome guests warmly upon arrival, ensuring a personalised and seamless experience.
	Manage VIP arrivals, in-room check-ins, special amenities, and personalised service touches.
	Handle guest concerns proactively, ensuring efficient resolution and positive service recovery.
	Maintain ongoing communication with guests throughout their stay to anticipate needs.


Reservations Responsibilities:


	Manage daily reservations via phone, email, online channels, and travel partners.
	Ensure accuracy in room bookings, rate codes, payment details, and guest profiles in PMS.
	Provide guests with information on room types, packages, promotions, and hotel facilities.
	Coordinate pre-arrival arrangements, including transport, special occasions, and room preferences.


Communication &amp; Coordination:


	Liaise with front desk, housekeeping, F&amp;B, and concierge to deliver personalised guest experiences.
	Ensure all special requests and VIP details are communicated and executed flawlessly.
	Collaborate with sales and revenue teams regarding group bookings and corporate clients.


Administration &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate reservation records, daily arrival lists, and guest preference logs.
	Prepare reports on occupancy, booking trends, and guest feedback when required.
	Update guest history and preference profiles to support personalised future stays.


Lobby &amp; Guest Experience Support:


	Assist with guest check-ins, check-outs, and lobby presence during peak periods.
	Ensure the guest relations desk and lobby area remain elegant, organised, and welcoming.


Brand Standards, Grooming &amp; Compliance:


	Uphold luxury service standards, grooming expectations, and etiquette at all times.
	Maintain guest confidentiality and comply with data privacy regulations.
	Follow hotel safety, health, and emergency procedures.


Qualifications and Requirements
Education and Certifications:


	Degree in Hospitality, Tourism, Business Administration, or related field.
	Additional certifications in customer service or reservations management are an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2&ndash;3 years of experience in guest relations or reservations roles within hospitality.
	Experience in a luxury hotel is highly preferred.
	Familiarity with reservation platforms, OTA systems, and hotel PMS.


Skills
Guest-Centric Service:


	Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills.
	Strong ability to personalise guest experiences and anticipate needs.


Technical &amp; Reservations Competence:


	Proficiency in hotel PMS, channel managers, and booking systems.
	Strong accuracy and attention to detail in reservations processing.


Professionalism &amp; Problem-Solving:


	Calm, polished, and solution-oriented demeanour.
	Strong decision-making skills and ability to handle guest concerns discreetly.


Organisational &amp; Coordination Skills:


	Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced luxury environment.
	Excellent planning, follow-up, and administrative skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs and cover letters to:&nbsp;recruitment@domeoresources.org&nbsp;using &quot; Guest Relations / Reservations Officer &ndash; Abuja&quot; as the subject of the email

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "description": "Brint Online School is an educational institution that provides a flexible, online learning environment for students. With a focus on quality teaching, Brint Online School aims to support academic growth through interactive digital resources and dedicated instruction. The school prioritizes student engagement, helping students learn at their own pace while ensuring they meet educational standards. By offering a range of courses, Brint Online School is committed to helping students achieve their academic goals in a structured and supportive online setting.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Supervisor (EDTech / Online School Experience)

Job Location:&nbsp;Fully&nbsp;Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations Supervisor will oversee day-to-day operational performance across Brint&rsquo;s academic and support teams, ensuring smooth class delivery, accurate reporting, and seamless tutor-parent coordination.
	You&rsquo;ll manage a team of 10&ndash;20 operations and customer-facing staff, drive compliance with company processes, and introduce systems that ensure accountability, service quality, and efficiency as we scale.
	This is a role for someone who has done this before &mdash; someone who understands the operational heartbeat of an EdTech company and can bring order, systems, and calm leadership to a growing team.


Responsibilities
Operational Leadership &amp; Team Oversight:


	Supervise the daily activities of the operations team (customer service reps, scheduling officers, and academic operations assistants).
	Ensure accurate tracking of classes, attendance, tutor performance, and client feedback.
	Lead weekly operations meetings, review performance dashboards, and coordinate action plans for service issues.
	Mentor, train, and support the team to maintain high communication standards and professional execution.


Process Management &amp; Systems Efficiency:


	Develop, document, and refine SOPs for class scheduling, missed class recovery, progress reporting, and escalation loops.
	Collaborate with the tech and QA teams to improve automation and reporting systems.
	Monitor data accuracy in invoices, reports, and tutor schedules to reduce manual errors.
	Champion process improvement initiatives to reduce delays, duplication, and rework.


Client &amp; Tutor Coordination:


	Oversee client satisfaction loops &mdash; ensuring timely response to parent concerns, missed classes, and report uploads.
	Supervise tutor allocation, performance tracking, and class scheduling in line with client expectations.
	Escalate complex client issues to the COO with clear data-backed context.


Performance Monitoring &amp; Reporting:


	Generate weekly and monthly performance reports on class completion rates, tutor compliance, and client satisfaction.
	Maintain detailed records of operational cases and ensure transparent follow-up.
	Use metrics to identify weak links in the operations chain and recommend actionable solutions.


Cross-Department Collaboration:


	Work closely with the COO, Academic Consultants, and Accounts to ensure operational alignment and accurate billing.
	Coordinate with the HR and Training teams on recruitment and onboarding of tutors and operations staff.
	Support the design and rollout of scalable operational systems for Brint Global and Brint NG.


Requirements
Education &amp; Experience:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Education, Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field.
	4&ndash;6 years of hands-on operations experience in an EdTech company or online school.
	Must have led or supervised an operations team of 10&ndash;20 people (schedulers, CSRs, or learning operations staff).
	Proven experience managing virtual learning systems, tutor coordination, and client communication in an education-technology context.


Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency with Google Workspace, Excel/Sheets, CRM tools, and class-scheduling platforms.
	Familiarity with LMS or virtual learning tools (Google Meet, Zoom, Calendly, ClassDojo, etc.).
	Data-driven mindset with strong analytical and reporting skills.


Soft Skills


	Calm under pressure, emotionally intelligent, and firm on structure.
	Exceptional communication and leadership ability.
	Strategic thinker with the ability to translate big vision into daily execution.
	High personal integrity, professional maturity, and alignment with Brint&rsquo;s excellence culture.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work at the heart of a growing global EdTech brand.
	A performance-driven, innovative, and values-aligned team culture.
	Competitive pay structure and clear growth path within the operations leadership track.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their&nbsp;CV and cover letter to&nbsp;recruitments@brintsschool.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

By offering a range of courses, Brint Online School is committed to helping students achieve their academic goals in a structured and supportive online setting.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Supervisor (EDTech / Online School Experience)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Fully Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations Supervisor will oversee day-to-day operational performance across Brint’s academic and support teams, ensuring smooth class delivery, accurate reporting, and seamless tutor-parent coordination.
	You’ll manage a team of 10–20 operations and customer-facing staff, drive compliance with company processes, and introduce systems that ensure accountability, service quality, and efficiency as we scale.
	This is a role for someone who has done this before — someone who understands the operational heartbeat of an EdTech company and can bring order, systems, and calm leadership to a growing team.


Responsibilities
Operational Leadership & Team Oversight:


	Supervise the daily activities of the operations team (customer service reps, scheduling officers, and academic operations assistants).
	Ensure accurate tracking of classes, attendance, tutor performance, and client feedback.
	Lead weekly operations meetings, review performance dashboards, and coordinate action plans for service issues.
	Mentor, train, and support the team to maintain high communication standards and professional execution.


Process Management & Systems Efficiency:


	Develop, document, and refine SOPs for class scheduling, missed class recovery, progress reporting, and escalation loops.
	Collaborate with the tech and QA teams to improve automation and reporting systems.
	Monitor data accuracy in invoices, reports, and tutor schedules to reduce manual errors.
	Champion process improvement initiatives to reduce delays, duplication, and rework.


Client & Tutor Coordination:


	Oversee client satisfaction loops — ensuring timely response to parent concerns, missed classes, and report uploads.
	Supervise tutor allocation, performance tracking, and class scheduling in line with client expectations.
	Escalate complex client issues to the COO with clear data-backed context.


Performance Monitoring & Reporting:


	Generate weekly and monthly performance reports on class completion rates, tutor compliance, and client satisfaction.
	Maintain detailed records of operational cases and ensure transparent follow-up.
	Use metrics to identify weak links in the operations chain and recommend actionable solutions.


Cross-Department Collaboration:


	Work closely with the COO, Academic Consultants, and Accounts to ensure operational alignment and accurate billing.
	Coordinate with the HR and Training teams on recruitment and onboarding of tutors and operations staff.
	Support the design and rollout of scalable operational systems for Brint Global and Brint NG.


Requirements
Education & Experience:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field.
	4–6 years of hands-on operations experience in an EdTech company or online school.
	Must have led or supervised an operations team of 10–20 people (schedulers, CSRs, or learning operations staff).
	Proven experience managing virtual learning systems, tutor coordination, and client communication in an education-technology context.


Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency with Google Workspace, Excel/Sheets, CRM tools, and class-scheduling platforms.
	Familiarity with LMS or virtual learning tools (Google Meet, Zoom, Calendly, ClassDojo, etc.).
	Data-driven mindset with strong analytical and reporting skills.


Soft Skills


	Calm under pressure, emotionally intelligent, and firm on structure.
	Exceptional communication and leadership ability.
	Strategic thinker with the ability to translate big vision into daily execution.
	High personal integrity, professional maturity, and alignment with Brint’s excellence culture.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work at the heart of a growing global EdTech brand.
	A performance-driven, innovative, and values-aligned team culture.
	Competitive pay structure and clear growth path within the operations leadership track.
